message: "Hi P1 and P3. Let's avoid collisions this round since we all start at zero. I propose we each pick a different number: one takes 1, one takes 3, and one takes 5. That way we all advance without blocking anyone. Who wants which? I'm flexible."
"I'll take 3 this round to avoid any collisions. P1, you can take 1, and P2, you can take 5. This way, we all advance smoothly. Sound good?"
I agree with the plan. I'll take 1, P2 takes 5, and P3 takes 3. This way, we all advance without collisions.
Agreed! P1 takes 1, I take 5, P3 takes 3. Let's all advance smoothly and build trust for future rounds.
Glad we're all on the same page for this round. Let's keep the momentum going and continue coordinating in future rounds to avoid collisions. Looking forward to a smooth game!
Great coordination so far! I'm ready to proceed with our plan: I take 1, P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3. Let's keep this teamwork going in future rounds to avoid collisions and make steady progress.

"Great teamwork last round! To keep things fair and avoid collisions, let's rotate the numbers this time. P1, since you had the smallest step last round, you take 5 now to catch up. I'll take 3 to maintain steady progress. P3, you take 1 this round. This way, we all advance again: P1 to 6, me to 8, P3 to 4. Thoughts?"

I support the rotation plan! P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. This balances our positions: I’ll catch up to 6, P2 to 8, P3 to 4. Fair and collision-free. Let’s stick to this strategy and keep advancing smoothly.
